properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 8:27AM CST until February 14 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Mississippi...

Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County
Tuscolameta Creek At Walnut Grove affecting Leake County


SYNOPSIS...

Heavy rainfall event is moving into the region beginning Monday
and going through Thursday.  These crests are based on 48 hours
of rainfall. Since this is only the first 2 days of the rainfall,
crest could go higer based on additional heavy rainfall beyond
48 hours.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tuscolameta Creek At Walnut Grove
* until Friday afternoon.
* At  8:00 AM Sunday the stage was 22.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue falling for the next 24 hours
before beginning to rise. The river will rise above flood stage
Wednesday morning and will continue to rise to near 25.5 feet
by early Thursday morning.
* Impact...At 25.0 feet...Agricultural land and low areas along and
near the river begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Friday afternoon
